content: READ SAMPLE: https://read.amazon.com/sample/B0DJ2J4D7CHello Bitcoiners!I am pleased to announce that 'The Bitcoin History Book 2008-2024' is complete.  The colour interior paperback version is now available on Amazon (ebook and hardcover will follow) at the following links:https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B0DGT2KRYVhttps://www.amazon.com/dp/B0DGT2KRYVBesides working full-time, it took two years to compile and write the book.  It covers Bitcoin history from inception to 30th June 2024.  It is aimed at an audience who wish to quickly read what has happened to Bitcoin in terms of development, price etc. Each yearly chapter includes 10 major events and around 20-30 less major (or minor) events, and a page dedicated to that year's price activity. If community members have questions, please leave a comment below, or message me.  I hope the book will become treasured by the whole community. (X/Twitter: @CryptoBooksAlt)What follows are 4 preview pages:

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: You have done such a brilliant job Tyke. So much effort went into this book as I have seen your threads over the years. I hope this book accomplishes all that you had in mind while writing. I will be recommending this book to my family, friends, colleagues, strangers and even enemies. Well done. I'll write a review on Amazon.

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: Great job OP, I would love to read it but nowadays time isn't my friend at all, i don't even have 2 hours free during the week, but i will buy your book soon and save it for the holidays. Have you thought about the option of selling it out of Amazon, you could get a domain and mount a website with WordPress and woocommerce for selling it without having to pay commissions to a 3rd party like amazon, that would be a better way to make some passive income from your book, or you could even create a thread just for selling the book, you should think about it.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Hey there, Tyke! Nice going with your book and getting it out there.  Thats awesome! To follow up on seoincorporation's idea, have you thought about maybe letting people pay in Bitcoin? That could be kinda neat and fit with the folks who might read what you wrote and  i mean, it probably lines up.  So maybe think about doing that?Wishing you the absolute best with your new book and sales launch!

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: Good initiative so far. Though we may find a lot of information about Bitcoin over the Google, we hope your book will help to get them all together. To be honest, it's very important to know Bitcoin history and Bitcoin technology as well. A lot of people don't know much about Bitcoin, and they just consider it an investment asset. Glad to see you spent a lot of time to present Bitcoin history as a book. Best wishes for you, keep it up.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: I've only read the preview and while I'll have preferred it talked more on what Bitcoin is and the early development conversations along with focus on decentralization, I understand that there's so much to cover and everything needs to be giving paper space.I'll be reading the book later and dropping a review after that. Great work, we need more stories about bitcoin from actual bitcoiners.

comments.body: It is great to finally have a book about bitcoin history. I think you should accept different mode of payment like fiat if someone prefer to pay fiat or cryptocurrency likr bitcoin if they want to pay bitcoin.
